job_description: Job Title VP Marketing, Brand Partnerships & Licensing Job Description I. Job Summary | Major goals and objectives. The Vice President of Marketing & Creative for Brand Partnerships & Licensing is a critical thought-leadership role that uses an analytical approach to recommend and activate strategies and marketing campaigns for our licensed lines across channels, including digital, print and social. This role will oversee a team that is responsible for all aspects of marketing campaigns across our partnerships, including campaign ideation and management, creative development, and performance reporting and analysis. They will be responsible for creating highly engaging and relevant marketing experiences that bring our licensed products to life, working in tandem with our key partners to achieve quarterly and annual goals. The person in this role may also be tapped to contribute to proactive pitches as we work to secure new licensing partnerships. About Your Contributions: Work closely with our licensing team leads and other priority account directors to achieve ambitious sales growth goals Work closely with external marketing partners on achieving shared KPIs as established by each business unit Own the vision, mission, strategy, and operational plans for licensing marketing and creative assets Manage a team of creatives and marketers tasked with development and deployment of all campaign assets; coach, mentor and raise the team’s ability to deliver and exceed expectations while creating opportunities for succession talent Produce flawless activations in close cooperation with internal and external stakeholders; ensure all content is on-brand, consistent in terms of style, quality and tone of voice, and optimized for user experience and performance for all channels of content – online, social, print, newsletters, video, etc. Manage operational and administrative functions to ensure specific projects are delivered efficiently Set, communicate and maintain timelines and priorities on every project Research and educate internal teams on best-in-class industry practices, new technologies, and creative innovations Manage and track marketing budgets and ensure effective spending and ROI Manage analytics and reporting for all campaigns, collaborating with internal teams to establish and maintain strong analytics and reporting capabilities About You 4-year degree required; marketing or business degree preferred. 5-7 years’ experience working in retail marketing and media planning driving product sales in-store and online Deep creative or media agency experience developing campaigns across channels Experience working with budgets of all sizes Track record of strong ideas brought to life. Expertise in creative ideation, campaign planning, project management/execution. Ability to use statistics, sales data, qualitative/quantitative results, and other hard measurable data to influence key decision makers Excellent time management, resource management, and planning skills Impeccable written and verbal communications skills with demonstrated ability to simplify the complex and write persuasive perspectives. Agile problem solver Passion for our brands It is the policy of Meredith Operations Corporation ("Dotdash Meredith", "the Company") to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, the Company will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Accommodation requests can be made by emailing ddm.hr@dotdashmdp.com. The Company participates in the federal E-Verify program to confirm the identity and employment authorization of all newly hired employees. For further information about the E-Verify program, please click here: https://www.e-verify.gov/employees Pay Range Salary: $130,200 - $185,400 The pay range above represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position and may change in the future. Actual pay may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to work location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Dotdash Meredith’s total compensation package for employees. Other compensation may include annual bonuses, and short- and long-term incentives. In addition, Dotdash Meredith provides to employees (and their eligible family members) a variety of benefits, including medical, dental, vision, prescription drug coverage, unlimited paid time off (PTO), adoption or surrogate assistance, donation matching, tuition reimbursement, basic life insurance, basic accidental death & dismemberment, supplemental life insurance, supplemental accident insurance, commuter benefits, short term and long term disability, health savings and flexible spending accounts, family care benefits, a generous 401K savings plan with a company match program, 10-12 paid holidays annually, and generous paid parental leave (birthing and non-birthing parents), all of which may vary depending on the specific nature of your employment with Dotdash Meredith and your work location. We also offer voluntary benefits such as pet insurance, accident, critical and hospital indemnity health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance. #NMG# Dotdash Meredith is America’s largest digital and print publisher. Our 40+ iconic and fast-growing brands harness the best intent-driven content, the fastest sites, and the fewest ads to help nearly 200 million people every month, including 95 percent of US women, make decisions, take action, and find inspiration. Dotdash Meredith brands include PEOPLE, Better Homes & Gardens, Verywell, FOOD & WINE, The Spruce, Allrecipes, Byrdie, REAL SIMPLE, Investopedia, Southern Living and more.
